md_tutorial_stories_message_21_1:
OK, time to fess up: I still have
one more lecture in me. It’s about
a great way to help Snorlax �毿Ｗgrow
big and strong��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_21_2:
Let’s give �毿Ｗcooking ��＀a whirl, so we
can make this Snorlax stronger
than ever!
md_tutorial_stories_message_22_1:
You can try your hand at cooking
up to �毿Ｗthree times a day��＀, each
within certain windows of time.
md_tutorial_stories_message_22_2:
These are �毿Ｗmorning��＀, �毿Ｗafternoon��＀,
and �毿Ｗnight��＀, so try to remember to
do some cooking when you have
the chance!
md_tutorial_stories_message_23_1:
Each Snorlax will �毿Ｗrequest ��＀the type
of dish or treat that it likes best.
md_tutorial_stories_message_23_2:
Looks like this week’s Snorlax
wants to eat �毿Ｗcurries and stews��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_23_3:
To start things off nice and easy,
let’s have you make a dish using
the Auto Cook option.
md_tutorial_stories_message_24_1:
Did you see how Snorlax’s
Strength �毿Ｗshot right up��＀ after
eating that dish?
md_tutorial_stories_message_24_2:
Eating your cooking will help
Snorlax build �毿Ｗmore Strength
��＀than Berries, so cook every day
to help Snorlax grow!
md_tutorial_stories_message_24_3:
The kind of dish you’ll end up
with when you cook will depend
on the �毿Ｗcombination of ingredients��＀
you put in the pot.
md_tutorial_stories_message_24_4:
Your helper Pokémon may
�毿Ｗoccasionally pick up��＀ ingredients
for you, so keep an eye out to
gather their finds.
md_tutorial_stories_message_24_5:
And that’s it for my cooking
lecture! Thanks for listening in!
md_tutorial_stories_message_25_2: Let’s go give Snorlax a taste!
md_tutorial_stories_message_26_1:
I readied some ingredients you’ll
need for cooking, so here you go!
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_1:
Oh! Welcome to the world of
Pokémon Sleep! I’m �쨗ｎNeroli��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_2:
I’m here to research �쨗ｎthe sleeping
habits of Pokémon��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_3:
You see, many creatures that we
call �쨗ｎPokémon ��＀live here.
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_5:
I’ve been working to record them
while they’re asleep to delve into
their sleeping habits.
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_6:
These islands are also home to
many �쨗ｎSnorlax��＀, and my research
has convinced me of one thing:
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_7:
These Snorlax somehow exert a
mysterious power to put Pokémon
around them to sleep!
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_8:
So I developed a device called the
�쨗ｎSleep Synchronizer ��＀to amplify
this snoozy power of Snorlax’s!
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_9:
I’ve been putting in some real
effort so we can sync your sleep
with that of a Snorlax and cause
more Pokémon to gather around.
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_10:
I’d like you to use this device
whenever you sleep so that we
can �쨗ｎstudy the sleep styles��＀ of
the Pokémon that gather here.
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_11:
Of course, you’ll need helpers to
assist you. For your first
research partner, I’ll entrust you
with a friendly �쨗ｎPikachu��＀!
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_12:
Try to get some sleep with your
new Pikachu. That’ll be the first
step in our research.
md_tutorial_stories_message_1_13:
Let’s get straight to readying
everything we need for your
first day!
md_tutorial_stories_message_2_1:
Let’s get started by checking the
sleep data you collected.
md_tutorial_stories_message_2_2:
Here you can see both how �毿Ｗlong��＀
�毿Ｗyou slept��＀ and your �毿Ｗsleep score��＀
for this session.
md_tutorial_stories_message_2_3:
An adult can reach a sleep score
of 100 by making sure they get
�毿Ｗat least 8.5 hours��＀ of sleep.
md_tutorial_stories_message_2_3_b:
A child can reach a sleep score
of 100 by making sure they get
�毿Ｗat least 11 hours��＀ of sleep.
md_tutorial_stories_message_2_4:
Your goal is to reach 100, so try
to get �毿Ｗas much sleep as you can��＀!
md_tutorial_stories_message_3_1:
Next, let’s look at your different
�毿Ｗsleep stages��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_3_2:
These �毿Ｗsleep stages��＀ help show
how �毿Ｗdeep your sleep��＀ is.
md_tutorial_stories_message_3_3:
When tracking your sleep, I
classify it into three stages:
�毿ＷDozing��＀, �毿ＷSnoozing��＀, and �毿ＷSlumbering��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_3_4:
Try to keep an eye on �毿Ｗhow your
sleep fluctuates��＀ over time.
md_tutorial_stories_message_4_1:
This next screen is where you can
see your �毿Ｗsleep type��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_4_2:
Your sleep type captures the
�毿Ｗqualities of that sleep session��＀ and
is decided based on�毿Ｗ comparison��＀
�毿Ｗwith your past sleep��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_4_3:
When you �毿Ｗdon’t have much data
��＀yet, your sleep will instead be
�毿Ｗcompared to generic sleep data��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_4_4:
Build up your own data to be
used for comparison, and the
�毿Ｗprecision of these measurements
will keep going up��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_4_5:
I ask that you do your best to
track your sleep every single
day, without fail!
md_tutorial_stories_message_5_1:
Finally, let’s turn our attention
to Drowsy Power.
md_tutorial_stories_message_5_2:
You see, �毿ＷDrowsy Power��＀ is what
I call the mysterious power that
Snorlax on these islands possess.
md_tutorial_stories_message_5_3:
It’s a power that seems to both
draw Pokémon close and �毿Ｗlull them��＀
�毿Ｗto sleep��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_5_4:
This power depends on a Snorlax’s
�毿ＷStrength��＀ (how much it has grown)
and �毿Ｗyour sleep time��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_5_5:
By increasing this power, you can
get �毿Ｗlots of different Pokémon to��＀
�毿Ｗcome sleep near Snorlax��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_5_6:
And then, you may discover some
of the �毿Ｗrare sleep styles ��＀they can
display!
md_tutorial_stories_message_5_7:
Now that we’ve covered all that,
let’s take a look at your Drowsy
Power for this sleep session!
md_tutorial_stories_message_6_1:
Well, well! Looks like Snorlax has
provided a nice, strong Drowsy
Power again today. Let’s check
on our sleeping Pokémon, then!
md_tutorial_stories_message_7_1:
It appears that Snorlax’s Drowsy
Power has drawn a small crowd
here to sleep!
md_tutorial_stories_message_8_1:
Nice job registering that new
sleep style in your Dex. Keep it
up as you research the other
Pokémon here, too!
md_tutorial_stories_message_9_1:
You’ll find that each species of
Pokémon can be classified as
having a particular �毿Ｗsleep type��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_9_2:
And �毿Ｗyour sleep type��＀ for a given
session will cause �毿ＷPokémon with��＀
�毿Ｗthat same sleep type��＀ to gather.
md_tutorial_stories_message_9_3:
Since your sleep type was deemed
to be �毿Ｗ� type ��＀this time...
md_tutorial_stories_message_9_5:
�毿ＷDozing-type��＀ Pokémon tend to
include �毿ＷGrass��＀ and �毿ＷBug ��＀types.
md_tutorial_stories_message_9_8:
Get plenty of sleep each day to
keep discovering different kinds
of Pokémon!
md_tutorial_stories_message_10_1:
Good work on that sleep research!
Now, I’d say it’s �毿Ｗsnack time��＀ for
the Pokémon.
md_tutorial_stories_message_10_2:
And Pokémon just love eating
Poké Biscuits!
md_tutorial_stories_message_10_3:
Why don’t we hand some out to
the Pokémon here, to thank them
for aiding us in our studies?
md_tutorial_stories_message_11_1:
Looks like 촀 has maxed
out its �毿Ｗfriendship points��＀!
md_tutorial_stories_message_11_2:
When you get close with Pokémon
like that, you can �毿Ｗbefriend them��＀.
Then they can help you out, too!
md_tutorial_stories_message_11_3:
And that’s it for snack time.
Why don’t we take a look at the
results of your research?
md_tutorial_stories_message_12_1:
So, do you think you’ve got the
gist of our research process?
md_tutorial_stories_message_12_2:
Basically, I’m asking you to help
me research the sleep styles of
any Pokémon that gather around
Snorlax thanks to your sleep.
md_tutorial_stories_message_12_3:
Then we’ll be able to fill in more
and more entries in the Sleep
Style Dex.
md_tutorial_stories_message_12_4:
Keep resting your very best and
I’m sure you and I can �毿Ｗcomplete
the Sleep Style Dex��＀, no problem!
md_tutorial_stories_message_13_1:
That wraps up our sleep research
for the moment! And while it’s a
bit sad, I’m afraid it’s time for us
to say farewell to this Snorlax.
md_tutorial_stories_message_13_2:
We’ll need to find another
Snorlax to help us out for the
coming week.
md_tutorial_stories_message_14_1:
Thanks for your help, Snorlax!
Take care!
md_tutorial_stories_message_15_1:
There are a lot of little islands
around these parts, and we seem
to find Snorlax living everywhere
we go.
md_tutorial_stories_message_15_2:
For now, I’d like us to focus our
research on�毿Ｗ Greengrass Isle��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_15_3:
While you’re filling in your Sleep
Style Dex, I’ll get to work on some
arrangements so you’ll be able to
access new areas in time, too.
md_tutorial_stories_message_15_4:
But for this week, go ahead and
select �毿ＷGreengrass Isle��＀!
md_tutorial_stories_message_16_1:
This Snorlax will be your new
�毿Ｗresearch partner for the week��＀.
Nice to meet you, Snorlax!
md_tutorial_stories_message_16_2:
Now this is really key if you want
to carry out your sleep studies
nice and efficiently:
md_tutorial_stories_message_16_3:
you must raise Snorlax up to
grow �毿Ｗas big as possible��＀!
md_tutorial_stories_message_16_4:
Each week, you’ll have seven days
�毿Ｗfrom Monday till Sunday ��＀to help
Snorlax build up Strength as you
carry out your research.
md_tutorial_stories_message_16_5:
Keep filling up more of your Sleep
Style Dex, and at the end of the
week, it’ll be time for us to say
farewell to this Snorlax.
md_tutorial_stories_message_16_6:
But that means we can move to a
new site and find another new
Snorlax to work with!
md_tutorial_stories_message_16_7:
So give it your all to raise this
Snorlax up as much as you can in
this week you have together!
md_tutorial_stories_message_17_1:
We’re nearly at the end of my
lectures, I promise! I just want to
teach you some basics of how to
�毿Ｗraise a Snorlax��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_17_2:
Pikachu gathered up some �毿ＷBerries
��＀while you slept, so try giving
them to Snorlax.
md_tutorial_stories_message_18_1:
See, eating Berries helped Snorlax
build up its �毿ＷStrength��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_18_2:
If you keep feeding Snorlax like
this, you can raise it to be big
and strong!
md_tutorial_stories_message_18_3:
You can also �毿Ｗcook��＀ dishes and
treats for Snorlax if you like.
Try tapping Snorlax later to give
it a go!
md_tutorial_stories_message_18_4:
Gosh, that was a lot to cover all
at once, but that’s it! Lecture
time is over!
md_tutorial_stories_message_18_5:
I still only scratched the surface
of all the things you can do here,
so try poking around to discover
what else you can learn.
md_tutorial_stories_message_18_6:
And good luck with that sleep
research! Sleep tight!
md_tutorial_stories_message_19_1:
Oh dear! Looks like your helper
Pokémon are �毿Ｗa bit weary��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_19_2:
With all they do to pitch in with
your research, you’ll find your
helpers can get �毿Ｗlow on Energy��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_19_3:
As they do, the speed at which
they help out will also get �毿Ｗslower��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_19_4:
Getting some shut-eye together
with you will let your helpers
�毿Ｗrecover ��＀Energy, depending on
�毿Ｗhow long you sleep��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_19_5:
So try to get lots of sleep for the
sake of your helpers, too!
md_tutorial_stories_message_20_1:
With a Sleep Pass, you can save
up �毿Ｗsleep points ��＀based on �毿Ｗhow long��＀
�毿Ｗyou sleep��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_20_2:
Then you can take the sleep
points you’ve earned to the
�毿ＷPoint Exchanges��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_20_3:
You’ll be able to trade them in for
some pretty �毿Ｗfancy items��＀—even
things like �毿ＷMaster Biscuits��＀!
md_tutorial_stories_message_27_2:
Every day that you help me out
by conducting research, I’ll be
sure to give you one of those
Bonus Biscuits.
md_tutorial_stories_message_27_3:
Now, why not give 촀
a Great Biscuit next?
md_tutorial_stories_message_28_1:
Today I’d like to give a little
lecture about a very prized item:
the �毿ＷMaster Biscuit��＀.
md_tutorial_stories_message_28_2:
Master Biscuits are amazingly
effective. If you give just �毿Ｗone
��＀of these special treats out...
md_tutorial_stories_message_28_3:
it will instantly fill a Pokémon’s
�毿Ｗfriendship points to the max��＀!
md_tutorial_stories_message_28_4:
Here, why not try giving a Master
Biscuit to a Pokémon of your
choice?
md_tutorial_stories_message_29_4:
I hope this hands-on lecture has
given you a good idea of just how
amazing these biscuits are.
md_tutorial_stories_message_29_1:
You can get Master Biscuits at
the �毿ＷSleep Point Exchanges��＀ by
trading in your sleep points.
md_tutorial_stories_message_29_2:
As a special gift to you, my
�毿Ｗnovice researcher��＀, I’ll provide you
with some bonus sleep points
each day.
md_tutorial_stories_message_29_3:
Work hard at your research for
seven days, and you’ll be able to
save up enough points to get
yourself a Master Biscuit!
